fields.headline: Websites
fields.bodyText: Design and Technology Association (DATA) Publications, resources, information on the association's CAD/CAM initiative, and a chance to join Validate, an informal network of educators interested in the values of D&T education. You'll also find details on training and professional development, and a useful primary section with dedicated projects and resources. The Nuffield Foundation The Nuffield primary design and technology project is currently developing materials for red-hot D&T teaching. Check up on its progress, look at other schools' work, or download sample classroom materials. Cad in Schools A visually ambitious site introducing the DfEE-sponsored Cad in Schools initiative, which aims to ensure all UK secondary schools have access to CAD/CAM facilities, and offers free copies of PTC's Prodesktop software. Includes a showcase showing off pupils' achievements. D&T Online A highly practical resource offering free materials, information and software on electronics, packaging, environments, food, pneumatics, mechanisms, and manufacturing projects. Largely targets key stage three and four, but also suitable for key stage two. Food Technology A comprehensive examination of all aspects of food technology for key stage four students and teachers, including food science, processes, business, and ICT in product development and manufacturing. Offers online analytical tools, direct links with industry professionals and case studies supported by video clips. Technology Insight Everything you ever wanted to know about design and technology in an industrial context, including virtual visits to production lines, ideas for teachers, advice for students on how to improve their work, and other resources and links. J Sainsburys Plc Details on how to enter the Sainsburys Food Awards Scheme for schools, as well as lots of information for those studying food technology. Includes product development case studies and a teachers' guide. Denford Limited This world leader in computerised milling machines and software offers details on using videoconferencing to help students grasp various aspects of information and design technology, plus an education section with projects and course materials. Textiles Online A thoughtful site that introduces pupils to textile production processes and their impact on the environment. The useful teachers' notes section has online activities, and you can also download documents with ideas on how to use the site in lessons. British Nutrition Foundation Food technology activities across all the key stages, as well as nutritional facts and information. You can also access details of the BNF's awards for GCSE and A-level students.
